categories.name: Process Improvement
categories.description: Recognition for streamlining processes, increasing efficiency, and reducing manual work

subcategories.name: Automation
subcategories.description: Implementing automated solutions to reduce manual effort
examples: automated 80% of our monthly reporting dashboards

subcategories.name: Optimization
subcategories.description: Improving existing processes to achieve better outcomes
examples: optimized the mobile app reducing load time by 60%

categories.name: Leadership and Team Development
categories.description: Recognition for leadership, team growth, and mentorship

subcategories.name: Team Leadership
subcategories.description: Leading teams to achieve high performance and growth

subcategories.name: Mentorship
subcategories.description: Guiding and supporting team members in their development

categories.name: Technical Expertise
categories.description: Recognition for exceptional technical skills and contributions

subcategories.name: Code Quality
subcategories.description: Delivering high-quality code and improving team quality

subcategories.name: Technical Innovation
subcategories.description: Implementing innovative technical solutions

categories.name: Business Growth and Impact
categories.description: Recognition for driving business growth and achieving significant impact

subcategories.name: Revenue Growth
subcategories.description: Contributing to increased revenue and business expansion

subcategories.name: User Engagement
subcategories.description: Improving user engagement and satisfaction

categories.name: Customer Satisfaction
categories.description: Recognition for delivering exceptional customer support and satisfaction

subcategories.name: Proactive Support
subcategories.description: Providing proactive and high-quality customer support
examples: proactive support and going above and beyond

categories.name: Data-Driven Insights
categories.description: Recognition for delivering data-driven insights and driving business decisions

subcategories.name: Data Analysis
subcategories.description: Providing insightful data analysis to inform business decisions
examples: delivers insights that drive business decisions

categories.name: Collaboration and Partnership
categories.description: Recognition for effective collaboration and partnership with other teams

subcategories.name: Cross-Functional Collaboration
subcategories.description: Working effectively with other teams to achieve common goals
examples: worked seamlessly with sales and product

categories.name: Ramp-Up and Onboarding
categories.description: Recognition for quickly adapting to new roles and delivering results

subcategories.name: Fast Ramp-Up
subcategories.description: Ramping up quickly in a new role and delivering exceptional results

taxonomy.reasoning: This structure fits the data because it captures the distinct types of recognition present in the messages, such as process improvement, leadership, technical expertise, and business growth. The subcategories provide further granularity and help to group similar recognition themes together. The categories and subcategories are derived from the language and content of the messages, rather than relying on generic HR labels.

categories.name: Operational Efficiency & Automation
categories.description: Recognition focused on streamlining processes, reducing manual effort, and improving system performance through technical changes.

subcategories.name: Process Optimization
subcategories.description: Awards for significantly reducing time or effort required for recurring tasks.

subcategories.name: System Performance Improvement
subcategories.description: Recognition for technical work that directly enhances speed, reliability, or uptime of core systems.

categories.name: Revenue Generation & Market Impact
categories.description: Recognition tied directly to measurable financial outcomes, market expansion, or exceeding sales/campaign targets.

subcategories.name: Direct Financial Growth
subcategories.description: Awards for achievements resulting in quantifiable new revenue or significant business expansion.

subcategories.name: Audience & Traffic Growth
subcategories.description: Recognition for efforts that substantially increase external reach or engagement metrics.

categories.name: Product Quality & Technical Excellence
categories.description: Focuses on the quality of the output, code, or product itself, often through rigorous development or testing practices.

subcategories.name: Code & Design Quality
subcategories.description: Acknowledging contributions that improve the underlying structure, maintainability, or robustness of software.
examples: thoughtful code reviews that improve team quality

subcategories.name: Insight & Decision Support
subcategories.description: Recognition for providing critical data or analysis that directly steers strategic business choices.
examples: consistently delivers insights that drive business decisions

categories.name: Team Development & Leadership
categories.description: Recognition centered on building, mentoring, and fostering the growth and success of team members.

subcategories.name: Talent Cultivation
subcategories.description: Awards for successfully mentoring individuals or ensuring team members advance professionally.

subcategories.name: Team Structure & Retention
subcategories.description: Acknowledging efforts in creating a stable, high-performing team environment.

categories.name: Customer & Stakeholder Focus
categories.description: Recognition for outstanding performance in direct interaction with users, clients, or cross-functional partners.

subcategories.name: Service Excellence
subcategories.description: Recognizing exceptional dedication to resolving user issues and achieving high satisfaction scores.

subcategories.name: Cross-Functional Collaboration
subcategories.description: Awards for successful integration and partnership across different departments to achieve a shared goal.
examples: worked seamlessly with sales and product

categories.name: Pace & Adaptability
categories.description: Recognition for speed of integration, rapid delivery, and immediate high impact upon joining or taking on new responsibilities.

subcategories.name: Rapid Onboarding & Impact
subcategories.description: Acknowledging new hires or individuals who quickly become major contributors.
examples: delivering exceptional results in first 90 days

taxonomy.reasoning: The messages cluster naturally around outcomes (Revenue, Efficiency) and inputs (Teamwork, Technical Quality). I used 6 main categories to avoid overlap, separating 'Operational Efficiency' from 'Product Quality' based on whether the change was process-focused (automation) or output-focused (code structure). The taxonomy moves from external impact (C2) to internal execution (C1, C3) and finally to people development (C4, C5, C6).
